clinical_study.brief_title: Assess the Safety and Pharmacokinetics of Ascending, Multiple Oral Doses of SPD489 in Adults With Schizophrenia
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo Controlled Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of Ascending, Multiple Oral Doses of SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine Dimesylate) in Clinically Stable Adults With Schizophrenia

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multiple ascending dose study; the purpose of this study is to examine the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics (levels of drug in the blood) of SPD489 in Schizophrenic Patients who are currently maintained on a stable dose of an antipsychotic medication.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure at Day 5: 50 mg
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure and pulse measurements were taken using an automated blood pressure monitoring device (ideally using the same device, the same arm and in the same position throughout the study). Measurements of vital signs were performed in triplicate (3 measurements) after the subject had been in a sitting position for at least 5 minutes. Each of the 3 triplicate readings were performed in succession, at least 1-2 minutes apart, with the cuff fully deflated between measurements. It was expected that the triplicate measurements be obtained within a 5-6 minute period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Steady-state Plasma Concentration-time Curve (AUC) of Lisdexamfetamine Dimesylate on Day 5: 50 mg
secondary_outcome.description: AUC can be used as a measure of drug exposure. It is derived from drug concentration and time so it gives a measure how much and how long a drug stays in a body.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score at Day 5: 50 mg
secondary_outcome.description: The PANSS is a validated measure that evaluates the presence, absence, and severity of 30 symptoms of schizophrenia including both positive and negative symptoms and general psychopathology. Each of the 30-items are rated on a scale of 1 (absent) to 7 (extreme) with a total scoring range of 30 to 210. Higher scores indicate more impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Scale for the Assessment of Negative Symptoms (SANS-18) Total Score at Day 5: 50 mg
secondary_outcome.description: The SANS was modified by eliminating the global and attention items; the score of the remaining non-global items is referred to as the SANS-18 total score. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Calgary Depression Scale for Schizophrenia (CDSS) Total Score at Day 5: 50 mg
secondary_outcome.description: CDSS is a 9-item scale to evaluate depression in subjects who have schizophrenia rated from 0 (absence of symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with a total score range of 0 to 27. Lower scores indicate less depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Simpson Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score at Day 5: 50 mg
secondary_outcome.description: SAS is a 10-item scale used to evaluate the presence and severity of extrapyramidal symptoms. The items are scored on a scale from 0 to 4 with item-specific definitions given for each point. Total scores range from 0 to 40. Lower scores indicate less impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Barnes Akathisia Scale (BAS) Total Score at Day 5: 50 mg
secondary_outcome.description: BAS scale has objective, subjective, and global impression components of akathisia (motor restlessness that manifests itself with an inability to sit still or remain motionless). Objective and subjective components are rated on a scale from 0 (normal/absence) to 3 (severe) and are summed yielding a total score of 0 to 9. Global impression is rated on a scale from 0 (absent) to 5 (severe) with a total score ranging from 0 to 5. Lower scores indicate reduced restlessness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Cognitive Test Battery (CogState Battery) Score at Day 5: Groton Maze Learning Test, 50 mg
secondary_outcome.description: This battery is a series of 4 computerized cognition tests (Groton Maze Learning Test, Detection Task, Identification Task, and One Card Learning Task) designed to measure reaction time, visual learning and reasoning, and problem solving. The entire battery takes approximately 12 minutes to complete. CogState scores are measured on a linear scale (no maximum score). The Groton Maze Learning Test measures total number of errors made in problem solving (lower score = better performance). The Detection Task is measured by speed of performance (lower score = better performance). The Identification Task is measured by speed of performance (lower score = better performance). One Card Learning Task measures the accuracy of performance (higher score = better performance).

The entire battery takes approximately 12 minutes to complete. CogState scores are measured on a linear scale (no maximum score). The Groton Maze Learning Test measures total number of errors made in problem solving (lower score = better performance). The Detection Task is measured by speed of performance (lower score = better performance). The Identification Task is measured by speed of performance (lower score = better performance). One Card Learning Task measures the accuracy of performance (higher score = better performance).

intervention.description: SPD489 administered orally in ascending doses (50mg, 70mg, 100mg, 150mg, 200mg, 250mg). Each of these doses will be administered once daily for 5 days. Total number of days dosed is 30 days.
Placebo Capsule(s) for oral use taken once daily for 30 days

criteria.textblock: Subjects must be diagnosed with schizophrenia, on a stable dose of an antipsychotic and not have any cardiac risk factors

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure at Day 5: 50 mg
outcome.description: Blood pressure and pulse measurements were taken using an automated blood pressure monitoring device (ideally using the same device, the same arm and in the same position throughout the study). Measurements of vital signs were performed in triplicate (3 measurements) after the subject had been in a sitting position for at least 5 minutes. Each of the 3 triplicate readings were performed in succession, at least 1-2 minutes apart, with the cuff fully deflated between measurements. It was expected that the triplicate measurements be obtained within a 5-6 minute period.
outcome.population: Safety Set consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

outcome.title: Area Under the Steady-state Plasma Concentration-time Curve (AUC) of Lisdexamfetamine Dimesylate on Day 5: 50 mg
outcome.description: AUC can be used as a measure of drug exposure. It is derived from drug concentration and time so it gives a measure how much and how long a drug stays in a body.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Set defined as all subjects in the Safety set who had evaluable concentration-time profiles for lisdexamfetamine and/or d-amphetamine.

Measurements of vital signs were performed in triplicate (3 measurements) after the subject had been in a sitting position for at least 5 minutes. Each of the 3 triplicate readings were performed in succession, at least 1-2 minutes apart, with the cuff fully deflated between measurements. It was expected that the triplicate measurements be obtained within a 5-6 minute period.
measure.population: Safety Set consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

outcome.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Lisdexamfetamine Dimesylate on Day 5: 100 mg
outcome.description: Cmax is a term that refers to the maximum (or peak) concentration that a drug achieves in the body after the drug has been administrated.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Set defined as all subjects in the Safety set who had evaluable concentration-time profiles for lisdexamfetamine and/or d-amphetamine.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score at Day 5: 50 mg
outcome.description: The PANSS is a validated measure that evaluates the presence, absence, and severity of 30 symptoms of schizophrenia including both positive and negative symptoms and general psychopathology. Each of the 30-items are rated on a scale of 1 (absent) to 7 (extreme) with a total scoring range of 30 to 210. Higher scores indicate more impairment.
outcome.population: Safety Set consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

group.title: SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine Dimesylate)(200 mg)
group.description: Oral 200 mg dose of SPD489 administered once daily for 5 days.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score at Day 5: 200 mg
measure.description: The PANSS is a validated measure that evaluates the presence, absence, and severity of 30 symptoms of schizophrenia including both positive and negative symptoms and general psychopathology. Each of the 30-items are rated on a scale of 1 (absent) to 7 (extreme) with a total scoring range of 30 to 210. Higher scores indicate more impairment.
measure.population: Safety Set consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score at Day 5: 250 mg
outcome.description: The PANSS is a validated measure that evaluates the presence, absence, and severity of 30 symptoms of schizophrenia including both positive and negative symptoms and general psychopathology. Each of the 30-items are rated on a scale of 1 (absent) to 7 (extreme) with a total scoring range of 30 to 210. Higher scores indicate more impairment.
outcome.population: Safety Set consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

measure.description: The PANSS is a validated measure that evaluates the presence, absence, and severity of 30 symptoms of schizophrenia including both positive and negative symptoms and general psychopathology. measure.population: Safety Set consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Scale for the Assessment of Negative Symptoms (SANS-18) Total Score at Day 5: 50 mg
outcome.description: The SANS was modified by eliminating the global and attention items; the score of the remaining non-global items is referred to as the SANS-18 total score. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.
outcome.population: Safety Set consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Calgary Depression Scale for Schizophrenia (CDSS) Total Score at Day 5: 50 mg
outcome.description: CDSS is a 9-item scale to evaluate depression in subjects who have schizophrenia rated from 0 (absence of symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with a total score range of 0 to 27. Lower scores indicate less depression.
outcome.population: Safety Set consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Simpson Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score at Day 5: 50 mg
outcome.description: SAS is a 10-item scale used to evaluate the presence and severity of extrapyramidal symptoms. The items are scored on a scale from 0 to 4 with item-specific definitions given for each point. Total scores range from 0 to 40. Lower scores indicate less impairment.
outcome.population: Safety Set consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Barnes Akathisia Scale (BAS) Total Score at Day 5: 50 mg
outcome.description: BAS scale has objective, subjective, and global impression components of akathisia (motor restlessness that manifests itself with an inability to sit still or remain motionless). Objective and subjective components are rated on a scale from 0 (normal/absence) to 3 (severe) and are summed yielding a total score of 0 to 9. Global impression is rated on a scale from 0 (absent) to 5 (severe) with a total score ranging from 0 to 5. Lower scores indicate reduced restlessness.
outcome.population: Safety Set consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

outcome.description: BAS scale has objective, subjective, and global impression components of akathisia (motor restlessness that manifests itself with an inability to sit still or remain motionless). Objective and subjective components are rated on a scale from 0 (normal/absence) to 3 (severe) and are summed yielding a total score of 0 to 9. Global impression is rated on a scale from 0 (absent) to 5 (severe) with a total score ranging from 0 to 5. Lower scores indicate reduced restlessness.
outcome.population: Safety Set consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Cognitive Test Battery (CogState Battery) Score at Day 5: Groton Maze Learning Test, 50 mg
outcome.description: This battery is a series of 4 computerized cognition tests (Groton Maze Learning Test, Detection Task, Identification Task, and One Card Learning Task) designed to measure reaction time, visual learning and reasoning, and problem solving. The entire battery takes approximately 12 minutes to complete. CogState scores are measured on a linear scale (no maximum score). The Groton Maze Learning Test measures total number of errors made in problem solving (lower score = better performance). The Detection Task is measured by speed of performance (lower score = better performance). The Identification Task is measured by speed of performance (lower score = better performance). One Card Learning Task measures the accuracy of performance (higher score = better performance).
outcome.population: Safety Set consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually.
